title: Brutal UFC fight ends with Tai 'Bam Bam' Tuivasa's blood spilled in the Octagon
text:
Australian fighter Tai 'Bam Bam' Tuivasa was bundled out of his UFC bout in less than two rounds after a flurry of attacks from his opponent.

The heavyweight had no answer for Sergey Spivak's punches and left him open to being choked out on the ground.

Tuivasa's blood littered the octagon at Melbourne's Marvel Stadium after the 'Polar Bear' grabbed momentum in the end of the first round.

Spivak continued his advantage into the second and Tuivasa was knocked to the canvas repeatedly.

He overwhelmed him on the ground and grabbed him in triangle chokehold that quickly forced the referee to end the fight.

Blood spurted from Tuivasa's face all over his chest and arms as his opponent laid into him as he lay on the ground trying to fend him off.

The 26-year-old has now lost three fights in a row and his lack of ground game was exposed each time.

Analysts questioned whether the latest defeat spelled the end of his career as his glaring weakness was too easy to take advantage of.

The heavyweight match was an undercard to the hotly-anticipated clash between Robert Whittaker and Israel Adesanya.
